meanings.definition: To reorganize fragmented data on a computer's hard drive.
meanings.sent1: I am defragmenting my computer to make it run faster.
meanings.sent2: She defragments her laptop regularly to keep it in good shape.
meanings.sent3: Defragmenting my files feels like putting together a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Defragmenting is like tidying up a messy room, but for your computer.
meanings.sent5: After defragmenting, my computer felt like it had a fresh start.

meanings.definition: The process of rearranging files on a disk to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent1: Defragmenting can help your computer work more smoothly.
meanings.sent2: I ran a defragmenting program to optimize my hard drive.
meanings.sent3: The defragmenting of data made the computer work like magic.
meanings.sent4: The defragmenting process is like organizing a messy bookshelf.
meanings.sent5: The defragmenting of files made everything faster and easier to find.

meanings.definition: Bringing together scattered parts or pieces into a unified whole.
meanings.sent1: The defragmenting process made the project come together seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: She had a defragmenting approach to solving complex problems.
meanings.sent3: His defragmenting mindset helped him see the big picture clearly.
meanings.sent4: The team had a defragmenting strategy that united everyone's efforts.
meanings.sent5: The defragmenting effort resulted in a beautifully cohesive final product.
